question:
Choose the correct option to complete this sentence:
Everything you need for your climb can be found in the village situated at the _______ of the mountain.

Choose the correct option to complete this sentence:
He bought the cottage with a _______ to doing it up and selling it at a later date.

Choose the correct option to complete this sentence:
He had always said yes. But this time he was going to put his ______ down.

Choose the correct option to complete this sentence:
I don’t know off-_______ . I’ll have to look it up in the encyclopedia.

Choose the correct option to complete this sentence:
I don’t think he’s really determined. In the end, he’ll get cold ________ and cancel the whole thing.

Choose the correct option to complete this sentence:
It was happening right under my _______ , and I didn’t realise it. I feel so stupid.

Choose the correct option to complete this sentence:
It’s a terrible car and what really gets up my ___________ is that I paid a fortune for it.

Choose the correct option to complete this sentence:
It’s impossible to anticipate all the questions that you are going to be asked. You’re going to have to think on your ________.

Choose the correct option to complete this sentence:
Mum had her ________ on the painting for months, so we bought it for her on her birthday.

Choose the correct option to complete this sentence:
Now it looks like I’m going to have to _______ the bill for the repairs.

Choose the correct option to complete this sentence:
The lecturer had such a ridiculous voice that neither of us could keep a straight ________.

Choose the correct option to complete this sentence:
The little girl was obviously very upset as she was sitting on the step crying her _______ out.

Choose the correct option to complete this sentence:
We ought to _______ home. It’s late and I’m working early tomorrow.
Choose the correct option to complete this sentence: We were the first company to set up business in China, so we have a _______ start over our competitors.
Choose the correct option to complete this sentence: Why do you always have to stick your ______ into other people’s affairs?
Choose the correct option to complete this sentence: You have to _______ it to Joe – his company is a roaring success.
Complete the collocations with an appropriate part of the body from the list below: He crossed his ................ .
Complete the collocations with an appropriate part of the body from the list below: She folded her ................ .
Complete the collocations with an appropriate part of the body from the list below: He stubbed his ................ .
Complete the collocations with an appropriate part of the body from the list below: He clenched his ................ .
Complete the collocations with an appropriate part of the body from the list below: His ............. was pounding.
Complete the collocations with an appropriate part of the body from the list below: He shook his ................ .
Complete the collocations with an appropriate part of the body from the list below: She sprained her ............. .
Complete the collocations with an appropriate part of the body from the list below: He cleared his ................ .
Complete the collocations with an appropriate part of the body from the list below: He didn’t bat a/an ................
Complete the collocations with an appropriate part of the body from the list below: He shrugged his ................ .
Complete the idiom in the following sentences with an item of clothing from the list below: Your coach is right. What you need is two or three years’ playing experience under your ................. .

Complete the idiom in the following sentences with an item of clothing from the list below: We were delayed taking off, the cabin crew were rude, and, to ................. it all, when we arrived in Prague, we were told that our luggage had been lost.

Complete the idiom in the following sentences with an item of clothing from the list below: It's not difficult to see who wears the ................. in that house. Look at the way she orders him around.
Complete the idiom in the following sentences with an item of clothing from the list below: These trousers fit me like a/an/- ................. .
Complete the idiom in the following sentences with an item of clothing from the list below: If you can't afford to lend me the money, tell me. I don't want you to be out of ................. .
Complete the idiom in the following sentences with an item of clothing from the list below: My opponent had a look of quiet confidence on his face. What did he have up his .................?
Complete the idiom in the following sentences with an item of clothing from the list below: It's time you pulled your ................. up and got down to some serious work. Your exam's next week.
Complete the idiom in the following sentences with an item of clothing from the list below: I don't know what I'd do if I were in her ................. . I guess I'd take the promotion.

Complete the idiom in the following sentences with an item of clothing from the list below: He bought luxury cars, jewels and he'd throw large, extravagant parties at the drop of a ................. .
Complete the idiom in the following sentences with an item of clothing from the list below: Why are you getting so hot under the .................? I only said I’d think about their suggestion.

Complete the idiom in the following sentences with an item of clothing from the list below: Granted he's not our most talented player, but calling him the worst football player on the planet was a bit below the ................. .
Complete the idiom in the following sentences with an item of clothing from the list below: No, he didn't resign. He got the ................. .
He doesn't want a _________ -collar job. He’d rather work outside than be stuck in an office all day.
I didn’t believe I’d won the prize until I saw it in black and ______.
I didn’t realise hockey was such a violent game. I’m _______ and blue all over.
I parked and quickly ran into the bank. I didn't realise I'd left my car on a double _______ line.
I wish I had _________ fingers like you. I only have to look at a plant and it dies.
If you don't know the company's number, look it up in the ________ Pages.
Now that the chairman has given us the _______ light, we can go ahead and buy Proudfoot's company.

She went as _________ as a sheet when I mentioned his name. I had touched a raw and painful nerve.
The bank refused to lend me any more money as my account was in the _________.
We hadn’t seen her in years and then the other day she came to visit us out of the _________ .
We live in the ________ belt just outside London. It's ideal as we live in the country but the city is right on the doorstep.
We only see each other once in a ________ moon, which is a shame really.
You can shout and argue until you're _______ in the face, but I'm not going to change my mind.
You can’t deny that you did it. You were caught ______- handed.
You should have seen the _________ look she gave him when he criticised her work.
You wouldn’t believe how much _______ tape is involved in getting a work permit here.
You're a coward. You're ________ . You were afraid to do it.

Before you buy the car, you'll have to pick out … .

Do you know what became of that girl Jane who used to work here? I haven't heard anything about her …

options.C: wanted to get to know her

question: I bumped into my old friend Robert when I went to … .

If Maria keeps coming to work late, she'll end up …

Isabel has grown up since the last time I saw her … .

question: John and his father sound the same when they speak, so I can't tell them apart when they … .
Lots of people want to be published writers, but only those who stick at it for a long time … .

options.A: he hates the sight of blood
options.B: he thinks he'd be good at it

question: When Tom saw his friends fighting some other boys, he joined in and ….
You should follow up a potential sale with a call or an email to the customer …
I wish George and his father would settle their ________ and start talking to each other again.
Our car started making a strange noise, so we had to ________ to the side of the road.
The police are ________ an investigation into the robbery.
This area of town is beginning to look very ________ and impoverished.
She always keeps ___________ about how much money she has and all the things she can buy.
After our quarrel we decided to go for a meal and ________.
He is such an arrogant colleague. I don't want to _______ his behaviour any longer.
He tried really hard and ran as fast as he could but simply couldn't __________ with the best runners.
I am going home anyway so I can _________ you _____ wherever you want.
Mum ________ at the local fitness centre twice a week.
The book I read didn't _________ my expectations, but maybe I was influenced by too many people.
The mayor offered his version of the plan but local residents __________ it at once.
They happened to be in the city for a short holiday so they just ___________ without calling in advance.
We decided to _________ the south because the weather was much better there.
We waited for over an hour but they simply didn't __________. Something might have happened to them.
When I retire I'll _________ some new hobbies like fishing or playing golf.
When I was a child I _________ Father Christmas, but that was a long time ago.
When we looked through the old albums we __________ a photo of my aunt.
When we went to high school we used to _________ on weekends in a nearby park.
A full scholarship to Harvard and you’re worried about leaving your job? Get real! You’d be a fool to ................ up a chance like that.
At first, her father was against her studying abroad, but later on he had a change of ........................ and let her go to Paris.
Both the favourite and then the second favourite pulled out. Naturally, we thought we were ................ a chance.
Chris was ........................ between buying a new house and going on a round-the-world cruise.
Given the appalling weather conditions on top of the mountain, I’d say the chances of their finding any survivors are very ................ indeed.
Harry was offered a scholarship to study in Spain and he ................ the opportunity with both hands.
He admitted taking a bribe and he doesn’t think he’s ................ his chances of getting re-elected?
I have to admit I’m in two ................... about whether to tell her or not.
I suppose that there is a ................ chance that he could win, but I can’t see it happening, myself.
I was in a ........................ as to what to do. If I told the truth, he would get into trouble, but if I said nothing I would be in more trouble.
I wish you would stop sitting on the ........................ and decide whose side you’re on.
I’m ______ two minds whether to go or not.
If someone offered me a posting in South Africa, I’d ................ at the chance.
If you need a decent suit, go to Munns Stores. You’ll be ........................ for choice.
It took the selection panel only twenty minutes to ........................ to a decision.
It was ................ by chance that we managed to find her.
It was a difficult decision, but in the end we ................. for a state rather than a private pension scheme.
No way will you beat him. You don’t ................ a chance. He’s a hundred times better than you are.
Of all the entries received, his was ........................ out for special praise.
Royson had deliberately disobeyed her orders. She had no alternative ........................ punish him.
They were the best economic analysts in the United States – a team hand-........................ by the President himself.
Two hundred and fifty people applied for the job. Of these, only twenty applicants were ........................ for interview.
We knew the concert was sold out, but we still went to the stadium ................ the off-chance that someone might want to sell us their tickets.
________, I believe that a goal is more likely to make us happy than people or things.
Kids do it when they can’t keep still.
Some people do it when they pray.
To gently push sb with your elbow to get someone’s attention.
To move into a position where your body makes a rounded shape. You do it on the floor or on a big sofa, often whilst reading a book or watching television.
When you shake because you are cold, you do it.
When you shake because you are frightened, you do it.
When you shake momentarily because you have seen, heard or eaten something unpleasant, you do it.
You do it to avoid something that has been thrown at your head.
You do it when you lower your body to the ground by bending your knees. When a football team is having its photograph taken, the players in the front row do it.
You do it when you make a small sudden movement because something has hurt you (an injection, for example) or something has made you jump.
You do it with your eyebrows when you are angry or you don’t understand.
You do it with your head when you are agreeing with someone or when you are saying yes.
I don’t mind swimming in the sea, _______ cold it is.
Languages develop over thousands of years to become ________ when the last speaker dies.
I was born and bred in London so I know the city like the back of my .................. .
Something was different about the place, but I just couldn’t put my .................. on what it was.
She stayed with us for six weeks and she was a real pain in the .................. . All she did was criticise me and complain about everything.
When she left, I was glad to see the .................. of her.
I think it’s time we got a new television. This one is on its last .................. .
It is difficult to make ends meet when you are the sole ................... for a large family.
They said I was the best boss they had ever had, but I think they were just trying to ...................... me up.
The police ................ the suspects for over six hours.
My exam was a piece of ............. . It couldn’t have been easier.
Malcolm’s still angry about being passed over for promotion but he should soon ........................ down.
You pay her £25 a week! That’s ........................ for a woman of her experience. (Meaning too little)
He’s got football on the .................. . It’s all he ever talks about.
“Turn on the air conditioning,” she said. “It’s like a ........... in here.”
I’m afraid an adventure holiday is not really my cup of ..................... . I’d rather laze by the pool at a luxury hotel.
The boss went ................... when I told him that Jamieson plc. had pulled out of the merger deal.
My sister and I may look alike, but in character we’re as different as chalk and ..................... .
She exaggerates everything, so take anything she says with a pinch of ..................... .
It was a joke! I was just pulling your .................. .
They’re so lucky! I’d give my right .................. for a house like theirs.
He fell head over .................. in love the minute she walked into the room.
Business has been awful. We’ve been losing money head over .................. .
Do you see how much better you feel now that you have got it off your ..................?
“There’s no way we can afford it,” she said. “It’ll cost an .................. and a leg
She had set her .................. on studying at Oxford but they turned her down.
We’re receiving food, but it is only arriving in dribs and ​_________.
We’re talking about my family here, my own flesh and _____. Of course I trust them.
That is an out-and-_____ lie; you’ve made it all up!
Having your private life splashed across the front pages of newspapers and glossy magazines is part and ______ of being a celebrity.
We took a couple of days off and went to the country for a bit of peace and ____.
His daughter is his pride and _____.
She’s far too prim and _______ to have written anything as scandalous as that.
After a lot of pushing and _______, I finally made it to the counter where everything had been reduced by 50%.
The two children, who had been missing for three days, were found safe and ______ hiding in an abandoned mine shaft.
When I get back, I want this place looking spick and ____.
It was touch and _____ whether they would allow us to leave the country.
If we leave bright and ​_______ tomorrow morning, we should get there by midday.
The government has introduced a scheme whereby up-and-_____ young athletes will receive financial support.
What family doesn’t have its ups and _____?
Even allowing for wear and _____, these chair covers should last for at least fifteen years.
After walking for three hours, we realised that we were well and _____ lost.
What do you mean I cheated? I won fair and ________, and you know it.
By and ______, most people would prefer to have a badly paid job that they liked rather than a well paid job that they disliked.
Good jobs are few and ______ between in days of high unemployment.
A shorter lunch break is new company policy, so we’ll just have to grin and ______ it.
We have yet to discuss all the ins and ______ of his proposal.
I was only 10 minutes late. Why are you making such a song and _____ about it?
Everything had been packed away in boxes except for a few odds and _____.
He set out to prove once and for ____ that Deakin’s alibi was nothing but a tissue of lies.
